habitat_description:
Southwest:
C. nelsoni occurs in the Tamaulpais region of western Texas and extreme southern New Mexico favoring rocky habitats within Chihuahuan desert shrub vegetation. Soils are typically rocky where slopes of cactus, creosote, sotol, and lechugilla dominate and provide scattered cover (Wislon and Ruff 1999, Best 1994). In Big Bend National Park, this species occurs between elevations of 700 and 1450 m at the base of the Chisos Mts. where it prefers rocky habitats with sparse stands of chino grass, sotol, bear grass, and candelilla, and avoids sandy washes. In southern Presidio County in Big Bend Ranch State Park, Nelson's pocket mouse utilizes desert scrub and grasslands as well as riparian and juniper vegetation (Schmidly 2004).
